title: Robert Conquest
added: Robert Conquest's work is controversial in the historiography of the USSR due to the discovery that he had worked as an agent for the secret British Cold War propaganda agency, the [[Information Research Department]] (IRD), and that he had committed plagiarism by publishing unattributed IRD material as though it were his own independent research.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Macdonald|first=Scot|title=Propaganda and Information Warfare in the Twenty-First Century|publisher=Taylor & Francis|year=2006|isbn=|location=Taylor & Francis e-library|pages=47}}</ref>

title: Robert Conquest
added: Robert Conquest's work is controversial in the historiography of the USSR due to the discovery that he had worked as an agent for the secret British Cold War propaganda agency, the [[Information Research Department]] (IRD), and that he had committed plagiarism by publishing unattributed IRD material as though it were his own independent research.<ref>{{Cite book|last=Macdonald|first=Scot|title=Propaganda and Information Warfare in the Twenty-First Century|publisher=Taylor & Francis|year=2006|isbn=|location=Taylor & Francis e-library|pages=47}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite book|last=Suny|first=Ronald Grigor|title=Red Flag Unfurled: History, Historians, and the Russian Revolution|publisher=Verso|year=2017|isbn=|location=London|pages=94}}</ref>
